subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Reporting
msgSnippet: We wrote our own runner that outputs the xml below. Our code is based on Ant, but Ant is not required. If there is interest, I can ask the management to share
messageBody:
We wrote our own runner that outputs the xml below. Our code is based on
Ant, but Ant is not required. If there is interest, I can ask the management
to share this tool with the community.

Regards,

David

ps. xpunit is for cross-platform unit since we also run in .NET



<?xml version="1.0"?>

<TestRun RunName="Regression Test Results" StartDate="05/08/2003
12:01:01.0340" EndDate="05/08/2003 12:01:02.0381" ElapsedTime="1.041">

<Property Name="java.runtime.version" Value="1.3.1_06-b01"></Property>

<Property Name="java.vm.version" Value="1.3.1_06-b01"></Property>

<Property Name="java.vendor" Value="Sun Microsystems Inc."></Property>

<Property Name="os.name" Value="Windows 2000"></Property>

<Property Name="os.version" Value="5.0"></Property>

<Property Name="language" Value="en"></Property>

<Property Name="locale" Value="US"></Property>

<Property Name="machine.name" Value="DavidVy"></Property>

<TestSuite SuiteName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava" SuiteId="none"
Failures="0" Errors="0" Tests="8" ElapsedTime="1.0410000000000004">

<TestCase TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testComplexTestSuite"
ElapsedTime="0.431"></TestCase>

<TestCase TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testSimpleTestSuite"
ElapsedTime="0.21"></TestCase>

<TestCase
TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testActiveTestSuiteTestSuite"
ElapsedTime="0.07"></TestCase>

<TestCase TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testSetupWithErrorSuite"
ElapsedTime="0.04"></TestCase>

<TestCase TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testTestSetupSuite"
ElapsedTime="0.05"></TestCase>

<TestCase TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testLogTest"
ElapsedTime="0.06"></TestCase>

<TestCase TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testErrorInTearDownTest"
ElapsedTime="0.05"></TestCase>

<TestCase TestName="xpunit.runner.test.XmlTestJava.testMultithreadedTest"
ElapsedTime="0.13"></TestCase>

</TestSuite>

</TestRun>

----- Original Message -----
From: "Ranjeet Sahay" <rsahay@...>
To: "JUnit" <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 08, 2003 7:49 AM
Subject: [junit] JUnit Reporting


> Hi,
>
> Is there a way of creating report with JUnit which displays how many
> tests passed
> and how many failed(with possibly more details). The GUI is not
> sufficient for reporting tests (which may be over 5000 running over
> hours).
>
> I have logs (using log4j) to look at but becomes awfull searching for
> failures in maze of results. I have seen stuffs at IBM sites and also
> can be made using
> ant junitreport. But is there more easier way of making reports using
> JUnit(add-on may be).
>
> Desparately look for easier way for reporting.
>
> Thanks.
>
>
>
>
>
>
